value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It was half the work of the audience. The audience was a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">large one. Fifteen hundred people, <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-greg" key="Greg, W. W.">Dr Greg</rs> computes was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>was</del> an average audience. Of them, the greater part <del>was is</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">were <del>in</del> apprentices, citizens, soldiers, the common people.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Their presence is in the being part of the house is</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">obvious. <del>They</del> It is they who draw up the <del>play</del></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">sheet of paper draws up a fire. <del>An eager</del> It is the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>audie</del> presence of an enthusiastic audience</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that makes the writer embrace a great [strides?] &</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">vast audacities beyond his private reach.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Yet the audience is silent.</l>
